name: Emma
culturalSignificance: The name Emma has been popular since the 19th century, often associated with elegance and classic literature. It gained prominence through Jane Austen's novel 'Emma', published in 1815, which helped cement its status as a timeless name.
modernContext: Emma remains a popular choice for baby girls in many English-speaking countries, frequently ranking in the top 10 names. Its simplicity and elegance make it appealing to modern parents seeking a name that is both traditional and contemporary.
literaryReferences: Emma Woodhouse, the protagonist of Jane Austen's novel 'Emma', is one of the most notable literary characters with this name.
personality: Emma is often associated with traits such as intelligence, charm, and independence, reflecting the characteristics of its literary namesake.
symbolism: The name Emma symbolizes strength and femininity, often associated with nurturing and caring qualities.
funFact: Emma was the most popular baby girl's name in the United States from 2014 to 2018, according to the Social Security Administration.

songs.title: Emma
songs.quote: Emma, Emmaline, I'm gonna write your name high on that silver screen.

famousQuotes.quote: I want to be a part of stories that are meaningful.
famousQuotes.context: Actress and activist known for her role as Hermione Granger in the 'Harry Potter' series.

famousPeople.name: Emma Watson
famousPeople.awards: MTV Movie Awards, Teen Choice Awards

famousPeople.name: Emma Thompson
famousPeople.awards: Academy Awards for Best Actress and Best Adapted Screenplay

moviesAndShows.title: Emma
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: A young, beautiful, and wealthy woman who enjoys matchmaking.

moviesAndShows.title: Once Upon a Time
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: A bail bondswoman who discovers she is the daughter of Snow White and Prince Charming.

moviesAndShows.title: Friends
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: The daughter of Ross Geller and Rachel Green.

characterQuotes.quoteSummary: Emma reflects on her matchmaking efforts and the unintended consequences.
characterQuotes.context: This quote highlights Emma's growth and self-awareness as she realizes the impact of her actions.
